Identify Your PTSD:
 Understand whatâ€™s causing your PTSD. Once you identify the source, you can work on addressing it.

Learn More About PTSD (Psychoeducation):
 Educate yourself about PTSD. Understanding the condition can help you manage its symptoms.

Identify Triggers:
 Recognize what triggers your PTSD symptoms and develop strategies to cope with these triggers.

Participate in Support Groups:
 Connecting with others who are experiencing the same struggles can provide comfort, reduce feelings of isolation, and help you cope

Practice Daily Relaxation Techniques:
 Techniques such as deep breathing, meditation, and yoga can help reduce symptoms of PTSD.

Do Positive Activities:
 Engage in activities that you enjoy and that can distract you from your symptom.

Establish a Daily Routine:
 Having a predictable routine can provide a sense of control and reduce feelings of fear.

Get Quality Sleep and Physical Activity:
 Good sleep hygiene can improve the quality of your sleep, and regular physical activity can help reduce anxiety.

Eat a Balanced Diet:
 Healthy eating can improve your overall well-being and help you manage your symptoms.

Limit Your Exposure to Negative Media: 
Graphic news stories or violent films can trigger PTSD symptoms.

Speak with a Mental Health Professional: 
Therapists can provide strategies for managing PTSD and help you understand and cope with your symptoms.
